Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>って古代カレギア文字が読めるんだネ。 ボクにも教えてくれない？
Entry.EnglishText: You can read ancient Callegean, right Hilda? Would you be willing to teach me?

Entry.JapaneseText: いいけど、私の指導は厳しいわよ。 覚悟はできてる？
Entry.EnglishText: I can, but I'm a rather strict teacher. Are you ready for that?
I could care less about that!

Entry.JapaneseText: 全然大丈夫って……あんた、昔の言葉を 覚える前に、違う勉強しなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: You could care less... Well, before you can go learning the ancient tongue, you have other things you need to study.

Entry.JapaneseText: えーッ！ どーしてーッ！
「全然」は、卑定を伴って使う言葉だ。
Entry.EnglishText: You're using a positive construction to convey a negative one.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「全然大丈夫ではない」 「全然良くない」と用いるのが正しい。
Entry.EnglishText: Something like "I couldn't care less," or "That doesn't bother me at all," would be the proper way to say it.
Entry.Notes: Japanese grammar reference yurusu me pls.
